data.name: Student Voter Information
data.description: Prepared beforehand using MongoDB, this database manages student voter information and authenticates the validity of students to cast their votes.

data.name: Voter Web Browser
data.description: Developed with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Handlebars, the application allows users to authenticate and cast their votes for the ballot.

data.name:
Node.js Server 
with RESTful API
data.description: Authenticates student login and voting status, uses Web3.jsto interact with the Ethereum node, requests transactions to the Ethereum network, and adds validated transactions to the blockchain via smart contracts.

data.name: Login
data.description: The voter logs in to the system using the credentials provided by the election administrator.

data.name: Invalid Credentials
data.description:
If the credentials entered are not valid, do not allow the voter to proceed and go back to step 1, else proceed
to step 3.

data.name: Render Voter Dashboard
data.description: The application renders the voter dashboard.

data.name: Trust Boundary
data.description: The database server trusts calls from the web application's identity

data.name: Trust Boundary
data.description: The web application includes dependencies such as secure password generators.

data.name:
Election Administrator
Web Browser
data.description: The web application developed with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Handlebars will the admin to authenticate themselves as well as cast their votes for the ballot.

data.name:
Node.js Server
with RESTful API
data.description: The application uses password-generator.js from Node.js to generate passwords for voters. It uses jsrsasign.js to create public and private keys for each voter. Administrators can export the credentials, passwords, and keys. The application hashes passwords with PBKDF2withHmacSHA256 and encrypts private keys using password-based encryption.

text.text:
Node JS Server
with RESTFUL API

data.name:
Node JS Server
with RESTFUL API
data.description: The application uses password-generator.js from Node.js to generate passwords for voters. It uses jsrsasign.js to create public and private keys for each voter. Administrators can export the credentials, passwords, and keys. The application hashes passwords with PBKDF2withHmacSHA256 and encrypts private keys using password-based encryption.

data.name: Register a candidate
data.description:
If the administrator intends to register a single candidate, proceed, else load candidates’ information
from a .CSV file to the application

data.name: Load candidate's information
data.description:
If the administrator intends to register a single candidate, proceed, else load candidates’ information
from a .CSV file to the application

diagrams.title: Part 1, Scenario 5

data.description: Perimeter Firewall
Perimeter Firewall
Perimeter Firewall
Perimeter Firewall

data.name:
Node.js Server 
with RESTful API
data.description: The controller retrieves the encrypted private key and public key of the voter from the database, then decrypts the private key to generate the digital signature. It generates a JSON file from the original ballot submitted by the voter, hashes the ballot to create a message digest, and encrypts the message digest using the voter's private key to create a signed ballot. The signed ballot is then encoded using Base64 format. Finally, the controller forwards the signed ballot, the original ballot, the public key, and the Base64-encoded signed ballot to the election module.

data.name: Send Filtered Ballot
data.description: The controller sends the filtered ballot to the voter based on their college and batch.

data.name: Submit Ballot
data.description: Voter answers the ballot and submits it.

data.name: Reauthenticate User
data.description: The application requires the voter to re-authenticate using their password.

data.name: Send Error Message
data.description: If the password is correct, proceed, else, notify the voter with an error message.

data.name: Send Transaction
data.description: The controller sends the transaction to be recorded in the blockchain.

data.name: Trust Boundary
data.description: The web application includes dependencies such as secure password generators.

data.name: Trust Boundary
data.description: The database server trusts calls from the web application's identity.

data.name: Trust Boundary
data.description: The web application sends transaction to the public Ethereum blockchain network.
